s.text: The Daily Telegraph said Saturday in an editorial that some of the report's conclusions "border on the insane," such as one recommending criminal prosecution of "offences involving racist language or behavior where such conduct can be proved to have taken place otherwise than in a public place."
I like to be able to reach up on my book shelf for one of Shakespeare's plays and I would like to think that people will do that with this [Morton's] book."

The Taliban "actively orchestrated" his disappearance, the paper said, and sent him with 10 armed guards to an abandoned mountain guerrilla base.

At the start of Monica Lewinsky's great week--the Andrew Morton book, the Barbara Walters interview, and an interview with British television's Channel 4 (for a reported $640,000)--the British press is full of her.

Asked if Monica carried a share of the blame for her relationship with President Clinton, he replied that it had been "a relationship between two adults," but that "it was totally irresponsible for the president to get involved with Monica to begin with."
